housing_pkg package

Submodules

housing_pkg.ingest_data module

housing_pkg.ingest_data.check_nulls(data)

If there are any null values in the data, return False. Otherwise, return True

Parameters

data – The dataframe you want to check for null values

Returns

A boolean value.

housing_pkg.ingest_data.fetch_housing_data(housing_url='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ageron/handson-ml/master/datasets/housing/housing.tgz', housing_path='data/raw')

> It downloads the housing.tgz file from the housing_url, extracts the housing.csv file from the housing.tgz file, and saves the housing.csv file in the housing_path directory

Parameters

housing_url – The URL of the housing dataset (defaults to the one hosted by

the University of California, Irvine) :param housing_path: The directory to save the dataset in

housing_pkg.ingest_data.load_housing_data(housing_path='data/raw')

It loads the housing data from the given path, and returns a Pandas DataFrame object containing the data

Parameters

housing_path – The path to the housing dataset

Returns

A dataframe

housing_pkg.ingest_data.prepare_train_test_data(housing)

  • Check for null values in the dataframe and drop them if any.

  • Create a new column called income_cat which is a categorical variable based on

the median_income column. - Split the data into train and test sets using the StratifiedShuffleSplit class. - Drop the income_cat column from the train and test sets

Parameters

housing – The dataframe that we want to split into train and test sets

Returns

A dictionary with two keys, train and test, each of which contains a data

frame.

housing_pkg.pipeline module

class housing_pkg.pipeline.CombinedAttributesAdder(add_bedrooms_per_room=True)

Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

fit(X, y=None)
transform(X)
housing_pkg.pipeline.build_pipeline()

It creates a pipeline that first transforms the data using the full_pipeline, then trains a RandomForestRegressor on the resulting data :return: A pipeline object that has a preparation step and a random_reg step.

housing_pkg.score module

housing_pkg.score.score_model(data, model_folder)

It loads the model from the model folder, makes predictions on the test data, and calculates the RMSE

Parameters

  • data – The dataframe to be scored

  • model_folder – The folder where the model is saved

Returns

The RMSE of the model
